main event: On 12 September 1954 at 13/0255Z, in Cape May, New Jersey, a civilian reported seeing 660 objects moving side by side, 1st magnitude, with 15-20 objects observed in one minute, all continuing on the same course.
interesting points: The sighting involved a large number of objects, 660 in total, moving in a coordinated manner.
The objects were bright enough to be visible against the full moon, indicating their significant brightness.
The speed of the objects was estimated to be 15-20 degrees arc in one minute, suggesting rapid movement.
One of the objects made a turn while the other continued south, demonstrating controlled and deliberate movement.
The observer reported clear weather with visibility of 15 plus, indicating optimal conditions for observation.
sighted object: 660 objects moving side by side, 1st magnitude
